newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down on profit-taking.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished lower on Thursday on profit-taking by individuals on Wednesday's gains and may edge lower on Friday, dealer said.

"As most of yesterday's buying was speculative, major players were quick to book profits," a dealer at KAB Securities said, adding the index might fall further as major investors were likely to wait for attractive levels.

The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index fell 8.61 points, or 0.55 percent, to end at 1,552.80. Losers led gainers 163 to 89. Turnover rose to 73 million shares from 72 million in the previous session.
Citicorp Investment Bank fell 1.90 rupees to 26.50 rupees. Adamjee Insurance rose 4.75 to 112.75. Dewan Salman Fibre fell 0.75 to 35.75.
Hub Power Co fell 0.55 to 37.70. PTCL fell 0.90 to 25.55. Sui Northern Gas rose 1.25 to 30.75. ICI Pakistan fell 0.95 to 24.35.
